name: Bench Press
instructions:
Lie flat on a bench with feet firmly on the ground.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Unrack the barbell and hold it straight above your chest with arms fully extended.
Lower the barbell slowly to your mid-chest, keeping elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Pause briefly when the barbell touches your chest.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, exhaling as you press.
Lock out your arms at the top and repeat for desired reps.
Rack the barbell safely after completing your set.

name: Barbell Rows
instructions:
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and bend knees slightly.
Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, palms facing down.
Hinge at the hips to lean your torso forward, keeping your back straight.
Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Lower the barbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for desired reps.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
instructions:
Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Keep your arms slightly bent and palms facing inward.
Raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor.
Pause briefly at the top, ensuring your shoulders are doing the work.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for desired reps.

name: Pull-Up
instructions:
Grip the pull-up bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, palms facing away.
Hang freely with arms fully extended and engage your core.
Pull your body upward by bending your elbows, driving your elbows down to the floor.
Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Pause briefly at the top of the movement.
Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for desired reps.

name: Deadlift
instructions:
Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes under the barbell.
Bend at the hips and knees to grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, palms facing down or mixed grip.
Keep your back straight, chest up, and shoulders slightly in front of the bar.
Engage your core and lift the bar by extending your hips and knees, keeping the bar close to your body.
Stand fully upright, locking out your hips and knees at the top.
Pause briefly in the standing position.
Lower the bar back to the ground by bending at the hips and knees, maintaining a straight back.
Repeat for desired reps.
